Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video actually shows an Eid-al-Fitr prayer in the Chinese city of Xining in 2015.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading video and does not provide any credible evidence to support the conversion of Chinese citizens to Islam due to COVID-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video is evidence of Chinese citizens converting to Islam due to COVID-19, without providing any substantiated proof or data.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the video shows a religious celebration that took place in 2015 and is not related to COVID-19 or conversions to Islam.
